title: Suggest restricting a type parameter with clone when attempting to clone out a ref

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Not entirely sure about the title, but the code is simple enough:

```rust
pub struct Wrapper<T>(Option<T>);

impl<T> Wrapper<T> {
    pub fn fail(&self) -> Option<T> {
        self.0.as_ref().map(|x| x.clone())
    }
}
```

Yields this error message:
```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/lib.rs:5:9
  |
3 | impl<T> Wrapper<T> {
  |      - this type parameter
4 |     fn fail(&self) -> Option<T> {
  |                       --------- expected `Option<T>` because of return type
5 |         self.0.as_ref().clone()
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected type parameter `T`, found `&T`
  |
  = note: expected enum `Option<T>`
             found enum `Option<&T>`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `bonfire`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

if you change  the contents of fail to this:

```rust
self.0.as_ref().map(|x| (*x).clone())
```

you get this actually quite helpful error message:
```
error[E0599]: no method named `clone` found for type parameter `T` in the current scope
 --> src/lib.rs:5:38
  |
5 |         self.0.as_ref().map(|x| (*x).clone())
  |                                      ^^^^^ method not found in `T`
  |
  = help: items from traits can only be used if the type parameter is bounded by the trait
help: the following trait defines an item `clone`, perhaps you need to restrict type parameter `T` with it:
  |
3 | impl<T: Clone> Wrapper<T> {
  |      ^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `bonfire`
```
